comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on July 27, 2023, 07:02:06 PMAdvice for investing:Never joined because of people, country, religion, community, and others. It's the way you are gonna get a dead end of your money because money not really seen from where you are come. Investing should be seperated from all-of these and only taken from neutral research.I completely agree with the advice on investing. When it comes to making investment decisions, it's essential to separate personal biases, emotions, and external influences such as people, country, religion, and community. Investing based on neutral research, objective analysis, and sound financial principles is crucial to making informed decisions that can potentially yield positive returns and safeguard your money.By removing emotional attachments and biases, investors can focus on understanding the fundamentals of the investments they are considering, assessing risks, and making well-informed choices that align with their financial goals. This approach allows for a more rational and strategic investment strategy, leading to better outcomes in the long run.In fact, I had a disappointing experience in the past when I joined a lending project that carried a religious endorsement, but it turned out to be a fraudulent scheme. That's why it is essential to verify and determine the authenticity of any project before investing.
